translation: Fourth Part of the Twenty-second Chapter of Good Friends

source_sentence: 爾時，具壽善現復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Kauśāmbī Sunbeam again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即般若波羅蜜多，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is this the perfection of wisdom, and can you practice the perfection of wisdom?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離般若波羅蜜多有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is there a dharma to be attained apart from the perfection of wisdom, and can one practice the perfection of wisdom?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即般若波羅蜜多空，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom while the perfection of wisdom is empty?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離般若波羅蜜多空有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice prajñāpāramitā apart from the fact that it's empty and has dharmas that are attainable?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即空，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom because it's empty?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離空有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom apart from the fact that empty existence is possible?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!
Is it possible to practice emptiness when it is emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離空有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice emptiness in order to escape emptiness and have dharmas to attain?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即般若波羅蜜多，能行空不？」
translation: Is this the perfection of wisdom that enables one to practice emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離般若波羅蜜多有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: Is there a dharma to be attained apart from the perfection of wisdom that allows one to practice emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即色，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom when it comes to form?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離色有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom apart from the fact that form exists and dharmas can be attained?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即受、想、行、識，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Why is it that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are capable of the practice of the perfection of wisdom?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離受、想、行、識有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice prajñāpāramitā in order to be free of sensation, perception, volition, and consciousness, since there are dharmas to be attained?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即色空，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom, which is form and emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離色空有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom apart from the fact that there are dharmas in form and space?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即受、想、行、識空，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom when feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are empty?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離受、想、行、識空有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice prajñāpāramitā apart from the fact that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are empty of dharmas and can be attained?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!
Is it possible to practice emptiness because it is form?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離色有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice emptiness in order to be free from the fact that form exists and dharmas can be obtained?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即受、想、行、識，能行空不？」
translation: Why is it that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are capable of practicing emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離受、想、行、識有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice emptiness in order to be free of sensation, perception, volition, and consciousness as existent dharmas?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!
Why is it that form is empty and can't we practice emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離色空有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice emptiness in order to escape form and space and have dharmas to attain?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即受、想、行、識空，能行空不？」
translation: Why is it that feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are empty and can't they be practiced as empty?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離受、想、行、識空有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice emptiness in order to be free of sensation, perception, volition, and consciousness, which are empty of dharmas?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即一切法，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom in regard to all dharmas?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離一切法有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom in order to be free of all dharmas in which there are dharmas to be attained?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即一切法空，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom when all things are empty?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離一切法空有法可得，能行般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice the perfection of wisdom in order to avoid the emptiness of all dharmas and the availability of dharmas?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!
Is it possible to practice emptiness, which is the case for all dharmas?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離一切法有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: Is it possible to practice emptiness in order to be free of all dharmas having dharmas that are obtainable?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為即一切法空，能行空不？」
translation: In order to realize the emptiness of all dharmas, can we practice emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為離一切法空有法可得，能行空不？」
translation: In order to avoid the emptiness of all dharmas and have dharmas to attain, can one practice emptiness?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"

source_sentence: 爾時，善現便白佛言：「若爾，諸菩薩摩訶薩以何等法，能行般若波羅蜜多及能行空？」
translation: It was then that the good present said to the Buddha, "If that's the case, what teaching can bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, use to practice prajñāpāramitā and to practice emptiness?"
The Buddha addressed the Śākyamuni, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 汝見有法能行般若波羅蜜多及能行空不？」
translation: Do you see any dharmas that practice the perfection of wisdom and are capable of practicing emptiness?"
The Zenkai replied, "No!
Bhagavān!"
The Buddha addressed the Śākyamuni, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 汝見有般若波羅蜜多及見有空是菩薩摩訶薩所行處不？」
translation: Do you see the perfection of wisdom and see emptiness as a place where bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice?"
The Zenkai replied, "No!
Bhagavān!"
The Buddha addressed the Śākyamuni, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 汝所不見法，是法可得不？」
translation: Is this a dharma you haven't seen, is this a dharma you can obtain?"
The Zenkai replied, "No!
Bhagavān!"
The Buddha addressed the Śākyamuni, "What do you think?
Is there arising and ceasing of unobtainable things?"
The Zenkai replied, "No!
Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告善現：「汝所不見、所不得法所有實相，即是菩薩無生法忍。
translation: The Buddha told Śaṇḍinya, "The true characteristics of the things you don't see and don't attain are the bodhisattvas' patient acceptance of the nonarising of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是無生法忍，便於無上正等菩提堪得受記。
translation: If the bodhisattva Mahāsattva accomplishes such forbearance of the nonarising of dharmas, then he'll be able to attain assurance of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於佛十力、四無所畏、四無礙解、大慈、大悲、大喜、大捨及十八佛不共法等無量無邊殊勝功德，名能精進如實行者。
translation: This is called a bodhisattva who can diligently and truly practice the Buddha's ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four unhindered understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and 18 Buddha-uncommon dharmas, among other immeasurable and limitless extraordinary qualities.

source_sentence: 若能如是精進修行，不得無上正等覺智、一切相智、大智、妙智、一切智智、大商主智，無有是處。」
translation: If someone thus diligently cultivates them, there's no place for them to attain the unsurpassed wisdom of correct enlightenment, the wisdom of all characteristics, great wisdom, marvelous wisdom, the wisdom of all things, and the wisdom of the great business owner."

source_sentence: 具壽善現復白佛言：「諸菩薩摩訶薩為以一切法無生法性，於佛無上正等菩提得受記不？」
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha, "Do the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and buddhas attain assurance of the Buddha's unsurpassed correct enlightenment based on the unborn Dharma nature of all things?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩為以一切法有生法性，於佛無上正等菩提得受記不？」
translation: Do bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and buddhas attain assurance of the Buddha's unsurpassed correct enlightenment based on the fact that all things have the nature of birth?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩為以一切法有生無生法性，於佛無上正等菩提得受記不？」
translation: Do bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, attain assurance of the Buddha's unsurpassed correct enlightenment based on the fact that all things are produced and unproduced in their Dharma nature?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩為以一切法非有生非無生法性，於佛無上正等菩提得受記不？」
translation: Do bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, attain assurance of the Buddha's unsurpassed perfect enlightenment on the basis that all things are neither produced nor unproduced by the nature of reality?"
"Pūrva!
well-presented!"

source_sentence: 爾時，善現便白佛言：「若爾，云何諸菩薩摩訶薩於佛無上正等菩提堪得受記？」
translation: It was then that the good present said to the Buddha, "If that's the case, how can all the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and buddhas attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and receive assurance of future enlightenment?"
The Buddha addressed the Śākyamuni, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 汝見有法於佛無上正等菩提得受記不？」
translation: Do you see a teaching that can be remembered in the Buddha's unsurpassed correct enlightenment?"
The Zenkai replied, "No!
Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我不見法於佛無上正等菩提堪得受記，亦不見法於佛無上正等菩提有能證者，證時、證處及由此證若所證法皆亦不見。
translation: I don't see a teaching that's capable of receiving assurance of the Buddha's unsurpassed correct enlightenment, nor do I see a teaching that's capable of realizing the Buddha's unsurpassed correct enlightenment, nor do I see the teaching realized when and where it's realized or what's realized by it.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 以一切法皆無所得，於一切法無所得中，能證、所證、證時、證處及由此證不可得故。」
translation: It's because all things are unobtainable, and within the unobtainability of all things, the actualizer, the realized, the time, the place, and the realization of this are unobtainable."
The Buddha told Śaṅgālī, "So it is!
So it is!
Just as you said.
You should know it well in the present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩於一切法無所得時，不作是念：『我於無上正等菩提當能證得，我用是法於如是時、於如是處證得無上正等菩提。』」
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva doesn't think this when all things are unobtainable, 'I will be able to realize unsurpassed correct enlightenment, and I will use this teaching to realize unsurpassed correct enlightenment at such a time and place.'"

source_sentence: 第四分天主品第二十三
translation: Fourth Chapter of the Lords of Heaven, Chapter 23

source_sentence: 爾時，天帝釋白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是般若波羅蜜多最為甚深難見難覺。」
translation: Thus, the perfection of wisdom is most difficult and profound to see and difficult to awaken to."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, "So it is!
So it is!
Just as you said.
Kauśika!

source_sentence: 如是般若波羅蜜多最為甚深，如是般若波羅蜜多難見難覺。
translation: Such prajñāpāramitā is most profound, and such prajñāpāramitā is difficult to see and difficult to realize.
Kauśika!

source_sentence: 虛空甚深故，如是般若波羅蜜多最為甚深，虛空難見難覺故，如是般若波羅蜜多難見難覺。
translation: Because space is so profound, thus the perfection of wisdom is most profound, and because space is difficult to see and difficult to awaken to, thus the perfection of wisdom is difficult to see and difficult to awaken to.
Why is that?
Kauśika!

source_sentence: 如是般若波羅蜜多自性遠離都無所有，如虛空故。」
translation: Thus, the own-nature of the perfection of wisdom is remote and completely nonexistent, like space."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋復白佛言：「非少善根諸有情類，能於如是甚深難見難覺般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟、廣為有情分別解說。」
translation: Śākyamuni then again said to the Buddha, "Are there any sentient beings with few good roots who are able to wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, correctly contemplate, and explain the profound, difficult-to-see, and difficult-to-awaken prajñāpāramitā to sentient beings in a discriminating way?"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, "So it is!
So it is!
Just as you said.
Kauśika!

source_sentence: 非少善根諸有情類，能於如是甚深難見難覺般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟、廣為有情分別解說，或能書寫廣令流布，是諸有情功德無量。
translation: "Are there any sentient beings, except those with few good roots, who are able to wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, correctly contemplate, and widely explain in detail for sentient beings the prajñāpāramitā that's so difficult to see and difficult to awaken, or who can write it down and spread it, that sentient beings of measureless merit?
"Kauśika!

source_sentence: 假使於此贍部洲中，一切有情悉皆成就十善業道。
translation: Suppose all sentient beings on this Jambudvīpa continent accomplished the tenfold path of good actions.
What do you think?
Do these sentient beings have much merit?"
The emperor explained, "Very much!
Bhagavān!
very much!
Well gone!"
The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 有善男子、善女人等，於此般若波羅蜜多甚深經典，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟、廣為有情分別解說，或能書寫廣令流布，是善男子、善女人等所獲福聚於前功德，百倍為勝，千倍為勝，乃至鄔波尼殺曇倍亦復為勝。」
translation: If there are good men and good women who wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate this profound scripture of the perfection of wisdom, and who explain it in detail for sentient beings or who write and disseminate it, the merit gained by such good men and good women will be one hundred times greater than the preceding merit, a thousand times greater, and even up to the level of the Upaniṣad, which is also greater."

source_sentence: 爾時，會中有一苾芻告天帝釋：「憍尸迦！
translation: At the time, a monk in the assembly addressed Śakra, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等，於此般若波羅蜜多甚深經典，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟、廣為有情分別解說，或復書寫廣令流布，是善男子、善女人等所獲福聚勝於仁者。」
translation: If good men and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate these profound sutras of the perfection of wisdom, and then explain them in detail for sentient beings or write them down and disseminate them, this is a good man or good woman who has accumulated more merit than a human being."

source_sentence: 天帝釋言：「是善男子、善女人等初一發心尚勝於我，況於般若波羅蜜多甚深經典，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟、廣為有情分別解說，或復書寫廣令流布！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, "Such good sons and good women are superior to me in their first initiation, so how could they wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, correctly contemplate, extensively explain in detail for sentient beings, or even write and disseminate the profound sūtras of the perfection of wisdom!
"Bhikṣu, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，亦勝一切世間天、人、阿素洛等所有功德。
translation: This is the accumulation of merit obtained by the bodhisattvas, Mahāsattvas, and it's superior to all the worldly merits of gods, humans, asuras, and so forth.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，非唯普勝世間天、人、阿素洛等所有功德，亦勝一切預流、一來、不還、阿羅漢、獨覺所有功德。
translation: This is the accumulation of merit attained by the bodhisattvas, Mahāsattvas, which is superior not only to the merits of worldly gods, humans, and asuras but also to the merits of all ascendants, first-comers, nonreturners, arhats, and pratyekbuddhas.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，非唯普勝一切預流、一來、不還、阿羅漢、獨覺所有功德，亦勝一切菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，為大施主修行布施。
translation: This is the accumulation of merit obtained by the bodhisattvas, which is not only superior to the merits of all pre-cursors, first-comers, nonreturners, arhats, and solitary realizers, but also superior to the skillful means of all bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and great givers who cultivate generosity apart from the prajñāpāramitā.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，亦勝一切菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，常所修學清淨尸羅、無缺尸羅、無隙尸羅、無雜尸羅、無穢尸羅、圓滿戒蘊。
translation: This is a cluster of merits obtained by a bodhisattva-mahāsattva that's also superior to all bodhisattvas, who part with the prajñāpāramitā's skillful means and always cultivate pure moral discipline, lacking in moral discipline, lacking gaps in moral discipline, lacking mixed moral discipline, lacking defiled moral discipline, and perfecting the aggregate of morality.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，亦勝一切菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，常所修學圓滿安忍，圓滿寂靜、無瞋無恨乃至燋木亦無害心究竟安忍。
translation: This is a cluster of merits obtained by a bodhisattva-mahāsattva that's also superior to all bodhisattvas, who are free from the many skillful means of prajñāpāramitā and always cultivate perfect forbearance, perfect tranquility, no hatred, and even the ultimate peace of mind that scorches wood and isn't harmful.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，亦勝一切菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，常所修學勇猛精進，不捨善軛、無怠無下，身、語、意業圓滿精進。
translation: This is a cluster of merits obtained by a bodhisattva-mahāsattva that's also superior to all bodhisattvas, who part with the prajñāpāramitā's skillful means, always cultivate vigorous and diligent effort, don't abandon good yokes, aren't lazy or indolent, and perfect their physical, verbal, and mental actions.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，亦勝一切菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，常所修學可愛靜慮、可樂靜慮、勇健靜慮、安住靜慮、自在靜慮、圓滿靜慮。
translation: This is a cluster of merits obtained by bodhisattvas, which is also superior to all bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and bodhisattvas who part with the prajñāpāramitā's skillful means and techniques and always cultivate meditation that's pleasing, meditation that's enjoyable, meditation that's courageous, meditation that's stable, meditation that's comfortable, and meditation that's complete.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所獲福聚，亦勝一切菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，常所修學諸餘善根。
translation: This is the accumulation of merit obtained by the bodhisattvas, and it's superior to all the other good roots that bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and bodhisattvas always cultivate in seclusion from the prajñāpāramitā's skillful means.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如說修行甚深般若波羅蜜多，有方便善巧故，皆勝一切世間天、人、阿素洛等，亦勝一切聲聞、獨覺，亦勝一切遠離般若波羅蜜多方便善巧諸菩薩眾。
translation: Because the bodhisattvas thus explain that they cultivate the profound perfection of wisdom and have skillful means, they are superior to all worldly gods, humans, asuras, and so forth, as well as to all direct disciples and solitary realizers, and to all bodhisattvas who are free from the skillful means of the perfection of wisdom.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如說修行甚深般若波羅蜜多，於深般若波羅蜜多究竟隨轉。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the profound perfection of wisdom as explained, and he follows the profound perfection of wisdom to its ultimate transformation.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩能紹一切智智種性令不斷絕，常不遠離諸佛、菩薩、真淨善友。
translation: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who can introduce the seed nature of omniscience and knowledge so that it doesn't stop, and he's never far from the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and truly pure good friends.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如是修行殊勝淨行，常不遠離妙菩提座，降伏眾魔制諸外道。
translation: Thus does the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivate superior pure practices, never leaving the marvelous throne of enlightenment, and subduing Māra to restrain non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如是學時方便善巧，常能濟拔溺煩惱泥諸有情類。
translation: Thus does the bodhisattva Mahāsattva train with skillful means that can always rescue sentient beings who are submerged in the mire of affliction.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如是學時方便善巧，常學菩薩摩訶薩眾所應學法，不學聲聞、獨覺乘等所應學法。
translation: Such is the skillful means by which the bodhisattva Mahāsattva always trains in the things that the bodhisattvas and Mahāsattvas should train, rather than in the things that the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha vehicles should train.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於深般若波羅蜜多如是學時，諸天神眾皆大歡喜，護世四王各領天眾來至其所，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，咸作是言：『善哉！
translation: When this bodhisattva Mahāsattva thus studied the perfection of wisdom, the gods and goddesses rejoiced greatly, and the four guardian kings of the world each led a multitude of gods to him, offering support and respect, honoring and praising him, and saying, 'Good!
Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 當勤精進學諸菩薩摩訶薩眾所應學法，勿學聲聞、獨覺乘等所應學法，若如是學疾當安坐妙菩提座，速證無上正等菩提。
translation: You must diligently apply yourself to studying the things that the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and not the things that the direct disciples and solitary realizers should study; if you thus train, you'll quickly sit on the marvelous throne of enlightenment and quickly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 如先如來、應、正等覺受四天王所奉四鉢，汝亦當受；如昔護世四大天王奉上四鉢，我亦當奉。』
translation: Just as the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Perfectly Enlightened One previously accepted the four bowls offered by the four heavenly kings, so will you accept them; just as the four great heavenly kings who protected the world in the past offered four bowls, so will I.'
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，我等天帝尚領天眾來至其所，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，況餘天神不詣其所！
translation: When this bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, we gods still lead celestials to his place to offer support, respect, and praise him, so why wouldn't other gods come to his place?
"Bhikṣu, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，一切如來、應、正等覺及諸菩薩摩訶薩眾，并諸天、龍、阿素洛等，常隨護念。
translation: When this bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, all the tathāgatas, arhats, and correct enlightenment, as well as the bodhisattva-mahāsattva congregations, gods, dragons, asuras, and so forth, are always there to guard and look after him.

source_sentence: 由此因緣，是菩薩摩訶薩一切世間險難、危厄、身心憂苦皆不侵害，世間所有四大相違種種疾病皆於身中永無所有，唯除重業轉現輕受。
translation: As a result, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's worldly hardships, perils, and physical and mental sorrows and pains won't be violated, and all of the world's four major contradictions and various illnesses will be permanently absent from his body, except for the manifestation of lighter sensations from heavy actions.
"Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如說修行甚深般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，獲如是等現世功德、後世功德無量無邊。」
translation: Thus, the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and bodhisattvas thus explain the skillful means of cultivating the profound prajñāparamitā, which obtains such merits in the present life and limitless merits in the hereafter."

source_sentence: 時，阿難陀竊作是念：「天主帝釋為自辯才讚說如是甚深般若波羅蜜多及諸菩薩功德勝利，為是如來威神之力？」
translation: Ananta then secretly thought, "Is it the Tathāgata's authoritative power that Lord Indra praises such profound prajñāpāramitā and the merits and victories of the bodhisattvas for his own eloquence?"

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋承佛威神，知阿難陀心之所念，白言：「大德！
translation: Then, in recognition of the Buddha's authoritative power, Indra knew what Ananta was thinking and said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 我所讚說甚深般若波羅蜜多及諸菩薩功德勝利，皆是如來威神之力。」
translation: The profound praises I've given to the perfection of wisdom and the merits and benefits of the bodhisattvas are all the power of the Tathāgata's authoritative presence."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告阿難陀言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Ānanda, saying, "So it is!
So it is!

source_sentence: 今天帝釋讚說如是甚深般若波羅蜜多及諸菩薩功德勝利，當知皆是如來神力非自辯才。
translation: Today, Indra praises such profound prajñāpāramitā and the merits and benefits of the bodhisattvas, knowing that they are all the result of the Tathāgata's supernormal powers and not his own eloquence.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 甚深般若波羅蜜多及諸菩薩摩訶薩眾功德勝利，定非一切世間天、人、阿素洛等所能讚說。」
translation: The profound prajñāpāramitā and the attributes and benefits of the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others are certainly beyond the ability of all worldly gods, humans, asuras, and so forth to praise."

source_sentence: 第四分無雜無異品第二十四
translation: Fourth Part, Without Complication or Difference, 24th Chapter

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告阿難陀言：「若時菩薩摩訶薩思惟般若波羅蜜多，習學般若波羅蜜多，修行般若波羅蜜多。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Ānanda, "Suppose a bodhisattva Mahāsattva contemplates prajñāpāramitā, trains in prajñāpāramitā, and cultivates prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 是時，三千大千世界一切惡魔皆生猶豫，咸作是念：『此菩薩摩訶薩為於中間證於實際，退墮聲聞或獨覺地；為趣無上正等菩提，能盡未來利樂一切？』
translation: At that point, all the evil demons of the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds become hesitant and think, 'Did this bodhisattva Mahāsattva fall back from the stage of śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha in order to realize the reality in the middle, and is headed for unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment that will bring benefit and joy to all in the future?'
"Again, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若時菩薩摩訶薩安住般若波羅蜜多，是時惡魔生大憂苦，身心戰慄如中毒箭。
translation: If the bodhisattva Mahāsattva then abides in the perfection of wisdom, that's when Māra becomes greatly distressed and distressed, and his body and mind tremble like a poisoned arrow.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若時菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多，是時惡魔來到其所，化作種種可怖畏事，所謂刀劍、惡獸、毒蛇，猛火熾燃四方俱發，欲令菩薩身心驚懼，迷失無上正等覺心，於所修行心生退屈，乃至發起一念亂意，障礙無上正等菩提，是彼惡魔深心所願。」
translation: If it's a time when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is practicing the perfection of wisdom and the perfection of honey, and a bad demon comes to him and creates all kinds of frightening things, such as swords, vicious animals, venomous snakes, and fierce fires blazing in all directions, in order to cause the bodhisattva to be frightened in body and mind, lose his unsurpassed mind of perfect enlightenment, become resigned in his mind with regard to what he's cultivating, and even give rise to a thought of confusion that hinders unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, this is what that bad demon deeply desires."

source_sentence: 爾時，慶喜便白佛言：「為諸菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，皆為惡魔之所擾亂，為有擾亂不擾亂者？」
translation: It was then that Śrī Siṃha then said to the Buddha, "When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas cultivate the perfection of wisdom, are they all disturbed by evil demons, and are there any who are disturbed or not disturbed?"

source_sentence: 佛告慶喜：「非諸菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，皆為惡魔之所擾亂，然有擾亂不擾亂者。」
translation: The Buddha told Qingshi, "It's not true that when bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they are all disturbed by evil demons, but there are those who are disturbed and not disturbed."

source_sentence: 具壽慶喜復白佛言：「何等菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，為諸惡魔之所擾亂？
translation: Guoshou Qingxi then said to the Buddha, "What kind of bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, are disturbed by evil demons when they practice the perfection of wisdom?

source_sentence: 何等菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂？」
translation: How does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva not become disturbed by evil demons when he cultivates the perfection of wisdom?"

source_sentence: 佛告慶喜：「若菩薩摩訶薩先世聞說甚深般若波羅蜜多，無信解心、毀訾、誹謗，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: The Buddha told Śrī Siṃha, "If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva who heard the teaching of the profound perfection of wisdom in a prior life lacks conviction, disparages, and denigrates it, then when he cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he'll be disturbed by harmful demons.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩先世聞說甚深般若波羅蜜多，有信解心、不起毀謗，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva heard about the profound prajñāpāramitā in a prior life and had faith and understanding and didn't criticize it, then when he cultivates the prajñāpāramitā, that bodhisattva Mahāsattva won't be disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩聞說如是甚深般若波羅蜜多，疑惑猶豫為有為無、為實不實？
translation: "If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva hears about such a profound prajñāpāramitā, does he doubt and waver about whether it exists, whether it doesn't exist, and whether it's real or not?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: "When the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of wisdom, then he'll be disturbed by harmful demons.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩聞說如是甚深般若波羅蜜多，其心都無疑惑猶豫、信定實有，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva's mind is free of doubt and hesitation when he hears and teaches such profound prajñāpāramitā, and he's confident that it really exists, then when he cultivates prajñpāramitā, that bodhisattva Mahāsattva won't be disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩遠離善友，為諸惡友之所攝持，不聞般若波羅蜜多甚深義處，由不聞故不能解了，不解了故不能修習，不修習故不能請問：云何應修甚深般若波羅蜜多？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is estranged from good friends and is taken in by bad friends, he doesn't hear the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, and because he doesn't hear it, he can't understand it, because he doesn't understand it, he can't cultivate it, and because he doesn't cultivate it, he can't ask, "How should I cultivate the profound perfection of wisdom?

source_sentence: 云何應學甚深般若波羅蜜多？
translation: "How should one train in the perfection of wisdom?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: When this is the case, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of wisdom, and then he's disturbed by evil demons.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩親近善友，不為惡友之所攝持，得聞般若波羅蜜多甚深義處，由得聞故便能解了，由解了故即能修習，由修習故便能請問：云何應修甚深般若波羅蜜多？
translation: If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva becomes close to a good friend and isn't disciplined by a bad friend, he'll hear the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, and as a result of hearing it, he'll be able to understand it, as a result of understanding it, he'll be able to cultivate it, and as a result of cultivating it, he'll be able to ask, "How should I cultivate the profound perfection of wisdom?

source_sentence: 云何應學甚深般若波羅蜜多？
translation: "How should one train in the perfection of wisdom?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: When this bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he won't be disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多，攝受、讚歎非真妙法，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: "If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva parts with the perfection of wisdom and takes in and praises what's not the true and wonderful teaching, then when he cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he'll be disturbed by harmful demons.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩親近般若波羅蜜多，不攝、不讚非真妙法，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: If a bodhisattva approaches the perfection of wisdom and doesn't accept or praise what's not the true and wonderful Dharma, then when he cultivates the perfection of wisdom, that bodhisattva won't be disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩遠離般若波羅蜜多，於真妙法毀呰、誹謗。
translation: "Suppose a bodhisattva Mahāsattva parts with the perfection of wisdom and disparages and denigrates the true and wonderful Dharma.

source_sentence: 爾時，惡魔便作是念：『今此菩薩與我為伴，由彼毀謗真妙法故，便有無量初學大乘諸菩薩眾於真妙法亦生毀謗，由此因緣我願圓滿。
translation: It's then that the evil demon thinks, 'Now that this bodhisattva is with me, because he denigrates the true and wonderful Dharma, there are measureless beginner Mahāyāna bodhisattvas who denigrate the true and wonderful Dharma, and this is the cause and condition for fulfilling my vow.

source_sentence: 雖有無量新學大乘諸菩薩眾與我為伴，然不能令我願滿足，今此菩薩與我為伴，令我所願一切滿足，故此菩薩是我真伴，我應攝受令增勢力。』
translation: Although there are measureless newly trained great vehicle bodhisattvas who have accompanied me, they haven't been able to fulfill my vows, but now that this bodhisattva has accompanied me and made all my vows come true, the bodhisattva is therefore my true companion, and I should take him in and make him more powerful.'

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: When this bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of wisdom, then he'll be disturbed by evil demons.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩親近般若波羅蜜多，於真妙法讚歎信受，亦令無量新學大乘諸菩薩眾於真妙法讚歎信受，由此惡魔愁憂驚怖，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: If the bodhisattva Mahāsattva becomes intimate with the perfection of prajñā and praises and believes in the true and wonderful teaching, and if he causes measureless numbers of newly training great vehicle bodhisattvas to praise and believe in the true and wonderful teaching, and this causes evil demons to become sad and frightened, then when the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of prajñā, he won't be disturbed by evil demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩聞說般若波羅蜜多甚深經時，作如是語：『如是般若波羅蜜多理趣甚深、難見、難覺，何用宣說、聽聞、受持、讀誦、思惟、精勤修學、書寫流布？
translation: If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva hears and teaches about the profundity of the Prajñāpāramitā, he says, 'Such is the profundity of the principles of the Prajñāpāramitā, which are difficult to see and difficult to awaken, so why is it necessary to preach it, hear it, retain it, recite it, contemplate it, diligently cultivate it, and write it down and disseminate it?'

source_sentence: 此經典為我尚不能得其源底，況餘薄福淺智者哉！』
translation: This is a scripture whose source is not yet accessible to me, so why shouldn't the rest of us who are poor in fortune and shallow in wisdom?'

source_sentence: 時，有無量新學大乘諸菩薩等，聞其所說心皆驚怖，便退無上正等覺心，墮於聲聞或獨覺地。
translation: At the time, measureless newly trained great vehicle bodhisattvas and others were terrified when they heard what they taught, so they withdrew from the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and fell into the stage of śrāvakas or solitary realizers.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: When these bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas cultivate the perfection of wisdom, they are then disturbed by harmful demons.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩聞說般若波羅蜜多甚深經時，作如是語：『如是般若波羅蜜多理趣甚深難見難覺，若不宣說、聽聞、受持、讀誦、思惟、精勤修學、書寫流布，能證無上正等菩提必無是處。』
translation: If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva hears and teaches the profundity of the prajñāpāramitā, he says, 'Such is the profundity of the principles and objectives of the prajñāpāramitā that are difficult to see and difficult to awaken, and if they weren't taught, heard, accepted, recited, contemplated, diligently cultivated, and disseminated in writing, there would be no place for them to realize unsurpassed correct enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 時，有無量新學大乘諸菩薩等，聞其所說歡喜踊躍，便於般若波羅蜜多常樂聽聞、受持、讀誦、令善通利、如理思惟、精進修行、為他演說、書寫流布，求趣無上正等菩提，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: At the time, measureless newly trained great vehicle bodhisattvas and others rejoiced and roused when they heard what they were taught, so they always enjoyed hearing, retaining, reciting, making skillful use of, correctly contemplating, diligently cultivating, explaining it for others, writing about it, and disseminating it, seeking to attain unsurpassed correct enlightenment, and when they cultivated the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas weren't disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩恃己所有功德善根，輕餘菩薩摩訶薩眾，謂作是言：『我能安住真遠離行，汝等皆無。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva relies on the merits and good roots he possesses and despises the other bodhisattvas-mahāsattvas, he says, 'I can abide in truly isolated practice, but none of you can.

source_sentence: 我能修習真遠離行，汝等不能。』
translation: I can cultivate truly isolated practices, but you can't.'

source_sentence: 爾時，惡魔歡喜踊躍言：『此菩薩是吾伴侶，流轉生死未有出期。
translation: At that point, the demon rejoiced and jumped up, saying, 'This bodhisattva is my companion, and my transmigration through birth and death has never ended.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩恃己所有功德善根，輕餘菩薩摩訶薩眾，便遠無上正等菩提，不能精勤空我境界。』
translation: Such bodhisattvas rely on the merits and good roots they possess, despise other bodhisattvas, become distant from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and aren't able to concentrate on the realm of emptiness and self.'

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas cultivate the perfection of wisdom, then they're disturbed by evil demons.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩不恃己有功德善根，輕餘菩薩摩訶薩眾，雖常精進修諸善法，而不執著諸善法相，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't rely on his own merits and good roots and despises other bodhisattvas, and although he always makes effort to cultivate good qualities, he doesn't cling to the characteristics of good qualities, then when he cultivates the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva won't be disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩自恃名姓及所修習杜多功德，輕蔑諸餘修勝善法諸菩薩眾，常自讚歎、毀呰他人，實無不退轉菩薩摩訶薩諸行、狀、相而謂實有，起諸煩惱言：『汝等無菩薩名姓，唯我獨有。』
translation: If a bodhisattva relies on his own name and the abundant merits he cultivates, despises the other bodhisattvas who cultivate excellent qualities, always praises himself and disparages others, and truly has no nonretrogressing bodhisattva's actions, appearance, and characteristics that are truly existent, he gives rise to various afflictions and says, 'You don't have the names of bodhisattvas, but I alone have them.'
Because of their arrogance, they despise the other bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 爾時，惡魔便大歡喜，作如是念：『今此菩薩令我國土宮殿不空，增益地獄、傍生、鬼界。』
translation: Then, the demon rejoiced greatly and thought, 'Now, this bodhisattva has made the palace of my land not empty and has enriched the hells, the world of unenlightened people, and the realm of ghosts.'

source_sentence: 是時，惡魔助其神力，令轉增益威勢辯才，由此多人信受其語，因斯勸發同彼惡見，同惡見已隨彼邪學，隨邪學已煩惱熾盛，心顛倒故，諸所發起身、語、意業皆能感得不可愛樂衰損苦果。
translation: As a result, many people believe and accept his words, which encourage them to share their bad views; after sharing their bad views, they follow their mistaken training; after following their mistaken training, their afflictions become raging, and their minds are mistaken; the physical, verbal, and mental actions that they initiate will all result in unpleasing, debilitating, and painful results.

source_sentence: 由此因緣，增長地獄、傍生、鬼界，令魔宮殿國土充滿，由此惡魔歡喜踊躍，諸有所作隨意自在，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: As a result, hell, unenlightened life, and the realm of ghosts grow, and the lands of Māra's palace are filled, so Māra rejoices and rises, and he does whatever he wants with abandon.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩不恃己有虛妄姓名及所修習杜多功德，輕蔑諸餘修勝善法諸菩薩眾，於諸功德離增上慢，常不自讚亦不毀他，能善覺知諸惡魔事，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva doesn't rely on his own false name and the many virtues he cultivates, despises other bodhisattvas who cultivate excellent qualities, is free of pride in those virtues, always refrains from praising himself or disparaging others, and is able to well perceive the works of harmful demons, then when he cultivates the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva won't be disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若時菩薩摩訶薩與求聲聞、獨覺乘者更相毀蔑、鬪諍、誹謗，是時惡魔見此事已，便作是念：『今此菩薩雖遠無上正等菩提而不極遠，雖近地獄、傍生、鬼界而不甚近。』
translation: If a bodhisattva, a mahāsattva, or someone seeking the vehicle of the śrāvakas or solitary realizers further vilifies, fights, and slanders them, then a bad demon sees this and thinks, 'Now, although this bodhisattva is far from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, he's not very far away, and although he's near hell, the world of animals, and the realm of ghosts, he's not very near.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，雖生歡喜而不踊躍。
translation: After that thought, although he becomes joyous, he doesn't jump for joy.

source_sentence: 若時菩薩摩訶薩與諸菩薩摩訶薩眾更相毀蔑、鬪諍、誹謗，是時惡魔見此事已，便作是念：『此二菩薩極遠無上正等菩提，甚近地獄、傍生、鬼界。』
translation: If the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and the crowd of bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others further denigrate, fight, and slander each other, then a bad demon sees this and thinks, 'These two bodhisattvas are extremely far from unsurpassed correct enlightenment, and they're very near hell, unliving beings, and the realm of ghosts.'

source_sentence: 作是念已歡喜踊躍，增其威勢，令二朋黨鬪諍不息，使餘無量無邊有情皆於大乘深心厭離，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，便為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: After that thought, they rejoiced and jumped for joy, increasing their authority and power, which caused the two factions to fight without stopping and caused the other measureless and limitless sentient beings to become deeply disillusioned with the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩與求聲聞、獨覺乘者不相毀蔑、鬪諍、誹謗，方便化導令趣大乘，或令勤修自乘勝善，與求無上正等菩提善男子等不相毀蔑、鬪諍、誹謗，更相教誨修勝善法，速趣無上正等菩提，轉妙法輪度有情眾，是菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，不為惡魔之所擾亂。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva doesn't disparage, fight, or denigrate those who seek the vehicle of the śrāvakas and solitary realizers, skillfully guides them to the great vehicle, causes them to diligently cultivate the superior goodness of their own vehicle, doesn't disparage, fight, or denigrate good men who seek unsurpassed correct enlightenment, and teaches them to cultivate superior good qualities, quickly proceed to unsurpassed correct enlightenment, and turn the wonderful wheel of the Dharma to save sentient beings, then when the bodhisattva-mahāsattva cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he won't be disturbed by harmful demons.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩未得無上正等菩提不退轉記，於得無上正等菩提不退轉記諸菩薩摩訶薩起損害心，鬪諍、輕蔑、罵辱、誹謗，是菩薩摩訶薩隨起爾所念不饒益心，還退爾所劫曾修勝行，經爾所時遠離善友，還受爾所生死繫縛。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has yet to attain the unsurpassed correct enlightenment and irreversible transformation record becomes hostile, fights, despises, insults, and slanders bodhisattvas, then that bodhisattva-mahāsattva will then give rise to that thought of not benefiting others, retrogress from the superior practices he once cultivated during that eon, become free of good friends during that time, and return to the bondage of birth-and-death that he once experienced.

source_sentence: 若不棄捨大菩提心，還爾所劫被弘誓鎧，勤修勝行時無間斷，然後乃補所退功德。」
translation: If he doesn't abandon the mind of great bodhi, he'll return to that eon, be armed with the great vow, and diligently cultivate superior practices without interruption, and then he'll make up for the merits he's retreated from."

source_sentence: 爾時，慶喜便白佛言：「是菩薩摩訶薩所起惡心生死罪苦，為要流轉經爾所時，為於中間亦得出離？
translation: It was then that Śrī Siṃha then said to the Buddha, "Is this the bad mind of the bodhisattva Mahāsattva that gives rise to the sins and sufferings of birth-and-death that causes him to go through this period of transmigration, and then does he escape in the middle?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩所退勝行，為要精勤經爾所劫被弘誓鎧，修諸勝行時無間斷，然後乃補所退功德，為於中間有復本義？」
translation: Is this the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's superior practice that has been set back, which has to be diligently cultivated through all these eons, wearing the great armor of vows, cultivating superior practices without interruption, and then making up for the virtues that have been set back, in order to have the original meaning restored in the interim?"

source_sentence: 佛告慶喜：「我為菩薩、獨覺、聲聞說有出罪還補善法。
translation: The Buddha told Revelation, "I teach for bodhisattvas, solitary realizers, and direct disciples that there's a good way to repay sins.
"You should know, Qixi!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩未得無上正等菩提不退轉記，於得無上正等菩提不退轉記諸菩薩摩訶薩起損害心，鬪諍、輕蔑、毀辱、誹謗，後無慚愧懷惡不捨，不能如法發露悔過。
translation: "If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has yet to attain the irreversible mark of unsurpassed correct enlightenment or who has attained the irreversible mark of unsurpassed correct enlightenment becomes harmful, fights, despises, insults, and slanders them, then has no conscience, harbors ill-will, and doesn't abandon them, and can't correctly reveal their repentance.

source_sentence: 我說彼類於其中間無有出罪還補善義，要爾所劫流轉生死，遠離善友眾苦所縛。
translation: I say that these kinds of people have no intention of repaying goodness for their transgressions, and they'll be subject to birth and death for many eons, far removed from the bonds of good friends and suffering.

source_sentence: 若不棄捨大菩提心，要爾所劫被弘誓鎧，勤修勝行時無間斷，然後乃補所退功德。
translation: If they don't abandon the mind of great bodhi, they'll be armed with a great vow for those eons and diligently cultivate superior practices without interruption, and then they'll be able to make up for the merits that were set back.

source_sentence: 「若菩薩摩訶薩未得無上正等菩提不退轉記，於得無上正等菩提不退轉記諸菩薩摩訶薩起損害心，鬪諍、輕蔑、毀辱、誹謗，後生慚愧心不繫惡，尋能如法發露悔過，作如是念：『我今已得難得人身，何容復起如是過惡失大善利？
translation: "If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has yet to attain the irreversible mark of unsurpassed correct enlightenment or who has attained the irreversible mark of unsurpassed correct enlightenment becomes harmful, fights, despises, insults, and slanders him, then he produces a conscience that's not bound to evil and finds a way to reveal his faults in accordance with the teaching and thinks, 'Now that I've attained a rare person, how could I again commit such a transgression and lose a great deal of good benefit?'

source_sentence: 我應饒益一切有情，何容於中反作衰損？
translation: I should benefit all sentient beings, but why should I allow myself to be harmed in the midst of it?

source_sentence: 我應恭敬一切有情如僕事主，何容於中反生憍慢、毀辱、凌蔑？
translation: I should respect all sentient beings as my servant and lord, but how could I be so arrogant, insulting, or dismissive as to do that?

source_sentence: 我應忍受一切有情捶打訶罵，何容於彼反以暴惡身語加報？
translation: How can I tolerate the beating and scolding of all sentient beings and yet allow them to retaliate with violent physical and verbal retribution?

source_sentence: 我應和解一切有情令相敬愛，何容復起勃惡語言與彼乖爭？
translation: Should I reconcile all sentient beings and make them love each other, how could I again give rise to harsh words and argue with them?

source_sentence: 我應堪耐一切有情長時履踐，猶如道路亦如橋樑，何容於彼反加凌辱？
translation: I should be able to tolerate all sentient beings trampling over me for a long time, just like a road or a bridge, so why should I allow them to insult me?

source_sentence: 我求無上正等菩提，為拔有情生死大苦，令得究竟安樂涅槃，何容反欲加之以苦？
translation: I seek unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in order to remove the great suffering of birth and death from sentient beings and bring about nirvāṇa of ultimate bliss, so why should I want to inflict suffering on them?

source_sentence: 我應從今盡未來際，如癡、如瘂、如聾、如盲，於諸有情無所分別。
translation: From now on, for the rest of eternity, I should be as dumb, as dumb, as deaf, and as blind as they come, with no discrimination among sentient beings.

source_sentence: 假使斬截頭足手臂、挑目、割耳、劓鼻、截舌、鋸解一切身分支體，於彼有情終不起惡。
translation: Even if I were to chop off their heads, feet, arms, pick their eyes, cut off their ears, wipe off their noses, cut off their tongues, or saw off their bodies and limbs, I would never do evil to those sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若我起惡，則便退壞所發無上正等覺心，障礙所求一切智智，不能利益安樂有情。』
translation: If I were to do evil, then I would retreat from the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment that I've aroused, hinder my pursuit of omniscience, and be unable to benefit or bring comfort to sentient beings.'
You should know this, Rejoice!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩我說中間亦有出罪還補善義，非要經於爾所劫數流轉生死。
translation: "Thus, I've described the bodhisattva-mahāsattva as having the intermediate sense of excusing sins and making amends, not going through this kind of transmigration through birth and death over many eons.

source_sentence: 惡魔於彼不能擾亂，疾證無上正等菩提。
translation: They can't be disturbed by evil demons, and they quickly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
"Furthermore, rejoice!

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩與求聲聞、獨覺乘者不應交涉，設與交涉不應共住，設與共住不應與彼論義決擇。
translation: Suppose bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and those who seek the vehicle of the śrāvakas and solitary realizers shouldn't negotiate, suppose they negotiate and don't dwell together, and suppose they dwell together and don't decide on the doctrine with them.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 若與彼類論義決擇，或當發起忿恚等心，或復令生麁惡言說；然諸菩薩於有情類不應發起忿恚等心，亦不應生麁惡言說，設被斬斫首足身分亦不應起忿恚惡言。
translation: If they were to decide on the meaning of a treatise, they might become angry and so forth, or they might cause harsh words to arise; however, bodhisattvas shouldn't become angry and so forth with sentient beings, nor should they give rise to harsh words, even if their heads and feet were chopped off.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩應作是念：『我求無上正等菩提，為拔有情生死眾苦，令得究竟利益安樂，何容於彼翻為惡事？』
translation: All bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas should think, 'I seek unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in order to remove the suffering of birth and death from sentient beings and bring about their ultimate benefit and happiness, so why would I allow that to be translated into something bad?'
Rejoice and be aware!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩於有情類起忿恚心、發麁惡言，便礙無上正等菩提，亦壞無邊菩薩行法。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, become angry with sentient beings and speak harshly, that will hinder unsurpassed correct bodhi and destroy the limitless bodhisattva practices.

source_sentence: 是故菩薩摩訶薩眾欲得無上正等菩提，於諸有情不應忿恚，亦不應起麁惡言說。」
translation: Therefore, when bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others want to attain unsurpassed correct enlightenment, they shouldn't be angry with sentient beings and shouldn't engage in harsh speech."

source_sentence: 爾時，慶喜便白佛言：「諸菩薩摩訶薩與菩薩摩訶薩云何共住？」
translation: At that point, Śrī Siṃha then said to the Buddha, "How do the bodhisattvas, the great bodhisattvas, and the bodhisattvas Mahāsattvas dwell together?"

source_sentence: 佛告慶喜：「諸菩薩摩訶薩與菩薩摩訶薩共住相視應如大師。
translation: The Buddha told Śrī Siṃha: "Bodhisattvas, Mahāsattvas, and Bodhisattvas living together should regard each other as great masters.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩與菩薩摩訶薩展轉相視，應作是念：『彼是我等真善知識，與我為伴同乘一舡、同行一道、同一所趣、同一事業，我等與彼學時、學處及所學法、若由此學皆無有異。』
translation: As they look at each other, the bodhisattvas and the bodhisattvas should think, 'These are our true good teachers who are our companions, who ride in the same boat with me, who walk together, who have the same destination, and who undertake the same task, and from whom there's no difference between us when we train, where we train, and what we train, if we train from them.'

source_sentence: 復作是念：『彼諸菩薩為我等說大菩提道，即我良伴亦我導師。
translation: Again, they think, 'Those bodhisattvas who teach us the great path to enlightenment are my good companions and my teachers.

source_sentence: 若彼菩薩摩訶薩住雜作意，遠離一切智智相應作意，我當於中不同彼學。
translation: If that bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in contaminated contemplation and is removed from contemplation associated with omniscience, I will train differently from them in the meantime.

source_sentence: 若彼菩薩摩訶薩離雜作意，不離一切智智相應作意，我當於中常同彼學。』
translation: If that bodhisattva, Mahāsattva, parts with complex contemplations and doesn't part with contemplations associated with omniscience and cognition, I will always train with them in the midst of it.'
You should know this, Rejoice!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩能如是學，菩提資糧疾得圓滿，速證無上正等菩提，於其中間無障無難。」
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, can train in this way, the accumulation of bodhi will be quickly completed, and they'll quickly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, with no hindrances or difficulties in between."

source_sentence: 第四分迅速品第二十五之一
translation: Chapter Four, Quick Chapter, Part Twenty-five, Section One

source_sentence: 爾時，具壽善現便白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Kauśāmbī Sunbeam said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為盡故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains for the sake of exhausting it, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為不生故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains for the sake of nonarising, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為滅故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains in order to cease, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為不起故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, train for the sake of not rising, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為非有故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains for reasons other than existence, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為遠離故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains in order to avoid, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為離染故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains in order to be free of defilement, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為虛空故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains for the sake of space, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為法界故學，是學一切智智不？
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains for the sake of the Dharma realm, is this training in omniscience?

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為涅槃故學，是學一切智智不？」
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains for the sake of nirvāṇa, is this training in omniscience?"

source_sentence: 佛告善現：「若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，非學一切智智。」
translation: The Buddha told the Good Shepherd, "If the bodhisattvas, when they are thus training, are not training in omniscience, then they are not training in omniscience."

source_sentence: 具壽善現復白佛言：「何緣菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，非學一切智智？」
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha, "What is the reason why the bodhisattvas, the mahāsattvas, don't train in omniscience when they are thus training?"
The Buddha addressed the Śākyamuni, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 佛證真如極圓滿故，說名如來、應、正等覺，如是真如可說為盡，乃至可說為涅槃不？」
translation: It's because the Buddha has realized the ultimate consummation of true thusness that he's called the Tathāgata, Worthy, and Completely Enlightened, and can such true thusness be described as exhausted or even as nirvāṇa?"
The Zenkai replied, "No!
Bhagavān!
What is the reason?

source_sentence: 真如離相不可說盡，乃至不可說為涅槃。」
translation: Truth as such is free from characteristics that can't be explained away, even if it can't be described as nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 佛告善現：「是故菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，非學一切智智。
translation: The Buddha told Shancheng, "Therefore, when bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas train in this way, they don't train in omniscience and cognition.
You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩不為盡故學，是學一切智智，乃至不為涅槃故學，是學一切智智。
translation: If a bodhisattva Mahāsattva doesn't train for the sake of exhaustion, he's training in omniscience, even if he doesn't train for the sake of nirvāṇa, he's training in omniscience.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 佛證真如極圓滿故，說名如來、應、正等覺，爾時證得一切智智真如非盡乃至涅槃。
translation: Because the Buddha has realized the ultimate consummation of true reality, he's called the Tathāgata, Worthy, and Completely Enlightened, and at that point he realizes that the true nature of omniscience is not exhausted but reaches nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 是故菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學一切智智。
translation: Therefore, when bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas train in this way, they're training in the cognition of all things.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，是學佛地，是學十力、四無所畏、四無礙解、大慈、大悲、大喜、大捨、十八佛不共法及餘無量無邊佛法，即為已學一切智智。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, this is training in the skillful means of the perfection of wisdom, this is training in the Buddha-stage, this is training in the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four unhindered understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the 18 uncommon dharmas of the Buddhas, and the other measureless and limitless Buddha-dharmas, which is to say that he has trained in the knowledge of all cognition.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，至一切學究竟彼岸。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and students thus train, they'll reach the final shore of all training.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，一切天、魔及諸外道皆不能伏。
translation: When bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and non-Buddhists thus train, they can't subdue all gods, Māra, or other non-Buddhists.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，速得菩薩不退法性。
translation: If bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas thus train, they'll quickly attain the bodhisattva's irreversible Dharma nature.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，速住菩薩不退轉地。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, he quickly abides in the bodhisattva's stage of nonretrogression.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，速當安坐妙菩提座。
translation: If the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, thus train, they'll quickly settle into the marvelous seat of enlightenment.
"You should know, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，行自祖父如來行處。
translation: "If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, thus train, they'll practice the Tathāgata's own grandfather's practice.
"You should know, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，即為已學與諸有情為依護法，是學大慈、大悲性故。
translation: When bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas thus train, that's when they train and become the guardians of sentient beings, which is why they train in the qualities of great kindness and great compassion.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學三轉、十二行相無上法輪。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and students thus train, this is the unsurpassed Dharma wheel that turns three times and has 12 defining activities.
"Good present, you should know!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學安處百千俱胝諸有情界，令住涅槃畢竟安樂。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and trainees thus train, this is the training that puts them in a position of ultimate comfort in the realm of a hundred thousand koṭīs of sentient beings, which causes them to abide in nirvāṇa.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學不斷如來種姓。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, this is training that doesn't stop with the Tathāgata's family.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學諸佛開甘露門。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and buddhas thus train, this is training that opens the door to the ambrosia of the buddhas.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學安立無量無數無邊有情住三乘法。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and thus trainees, this is training that establishes the abiding in the three-vehicle teaching of measureless, countless, and limitless sentient beings.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，是學示現一切有情究竟寂滅真無為界，是為修學一切智智。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and trainees thus train, this is the cultivation of the cognition of omniscience that shows the truly nonproductive realm of the ultimate extinction of all sentient beings.
"You should know this, good present!

source_sentence: 如是學者，下劣有情所不能學。
translation: Such a scholar is incapable of being trained by inferior sentient beings.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 如是學者，欲善拔濟一切有情生死大苦，欲善安立一切有情廣大勝事，欲與有情同受畢竟利益安樂，欲與有情同證無上正等菩提，欲與有情同學自利利他妙行，如太虛空無斷無盡。
translation: Such a person wants to skillfully relieve all sentient beings of the great suffering of birth and death, skillfully establish vastly superior things for all sentient beings, want to experience the ultimate benefit and happiness with sentient beings, want to realize unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment with sentient beings, and want to share with sentient beings the wondrous practice of self-benefiting and improving others, just like space, which is uninterrupted and inexhaustible.
"Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，決定不墮一切地獄、傍生、鬼界、阿素洛中，決定不生邊地達絮蔑戾車中，決定不生旃荼羅家、補羯娑家及餘種種貧窮、下賤、不律儀家，決定不生種種工巧、妓樂、商賈、雜穢之家。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, he's certain not to fall into any hells, unenlightened beings, the realm of ghosts, or asuras, certain not to be born among the borderlands' dharmas, certain not to be born in a house of a candra, a house of a pukkasa, or any other kind of poor, lowly, or undisciplined family, and certain not to be born in a house of various craftsmen, musicians, merchants, or impure people.
"Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，隨所生處終不盲聾、瘖瘂、攣躄、根支殘缺、背僂、癲癎、癰疽、疥癩、痔漏、惡瘡，不長不短亦不黧黑，及無種種穢惡瘡病。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and bodhisattvas thus train, wherever they are born, they will never become blind, deaf, dumb, paralyzed, handicapped in the faculties, backslidden, epileptic, abscesses, scabby, leaking hemorrhoids, or malignant sores, which are neither long nor short, nor sallow, and which are free of various kinds of filthy sores and diseases.
"Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，生生常得眷屬圓滿、諸根圓滿、支體圓滿，音聲清亮、形貌端嚴，言詞威肅眾人愛敬。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, his births will always result in the full completion of his retinue, the full completion of his faculties, the full completion of his limbs, a clear voice, an appearance that's dignified, and words that are dignified and well-respected by people.
"Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，所生之處離害生命，離不與取，離欲邪行，離虛誑語，離麁惡語，離離間語，離雜穢語，亦離貪欲、瞋恚、邪見，終不攝受虛妄邪法，不以邪法而自活命，亦不攝受破戒、惡見、謗法有情以為親友。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, the place where he's born is free of harmful life, free of taking what's not given, free of desiring wrong behavior, free of false speech, free of crude speech, free of indirect speech, free of defiled speech, and free of desire, anger, and wrong views, he will never take in false and wrong dharmas, never take his own life by using wrong dharmas, and never take in sentient beings who violate the precepts, hold bad views, or denigrate the Dharma as friends or relatives.
"Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，終不生於耽樂少慧長壽天處。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thus trains, he'll never be born in a heaven where he enjoys few wisdoms and has a long life.
Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩成就方便善巧勢力，由此方便善巧勢力，雖能數入靜慮、無量及無色定，而不隨彼勢力受生。
translation: "Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva accomplishes the power of skillful means, and although he can repeatedly enter meditative, immeasurable, and formless concentrations because of the power of these skillful means, he doesn't take birth according to the power of those concentrations.

source_sentence: 甚深般若波羅蜜多所攝受故，成就如是方便善巧，於諸定中雖常獲得入出自在，而不隨彼諸定勢力生長壽天，廢修菩薩摩訶薩行。
translation: Because they're subsumed by the profound perfection of wisdom, they accomplish such skillful means that, although they always attain mastery in those concentrations, they don't follow the power of those concentrations to grow up for a long life and discontinue cultivating bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices.
"Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，得清淨力、清淨無畏、清淨佛法。」
translation: If the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and thus trained [buddhas] attain pure powers, pure fearlessness, and pure Buddha qualities, then."

source_sentence: 具壽善現便白佛言：「若一切法本性清淨，云何菩薩摩訶薩眾如是學時，復能證得清淨諸力、清淨無畏、清淨佛法？」
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha, "If all things are inherently pure, how could the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others who thus train realize pure powers, pure fearlessness, and pure Buddha dharmas?"
The Buddha told Śubhavyūha, "So it is!
So it is!
As you've said.
The original nature of all dharmas is pure.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於一切法本性淨中，精勤修學甚深般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，如實通達心不沈沒亦無滯礙，遠離一切煩惱染著。
translation: Because the bodhisattva diligently cultivates the profound prajñāpāramitā techniques and skillful means in the innate purity of all things, he accurately comprehends that his mind isn't submerged or obstructed, and he's free of all afflictive and defiled attachments.

source_sentence: 故說菩薩如是學時，於一切法復得清淨，由此因緣得清淨力、清淨無畏、清淨佛法。
translation: It's therefore said that when a bodhisattva thus trains, he again attains purity in all things, and this is the cause and condition for attaining pure power, pure fearlessness, and pure Buddhahood.
"Furthermore, good performance!

source_sentence: 雖一切法本性清淨，而諸異生不知、見、覺。
translation: Although the nature of all things is originally pure, ordinary people don't know, see, or awaken to them.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩為欲令彼知、見、覺故，發勤精進修行般若波羅蜜多方便善巧，作如是念：『我於諸法本性清淨知、見、覺已，如實開悟一切有情，令於諸法本性清淨亦知、見、覺。』
translation: Because he wants to make them know, see, and awaken, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva diligently cultivates the skillful means of prajñāpāramitā and thinks, 'After I know, see, and awaken to the innate purity of all things, I will truly enlighten all sentient beings so that they will also know, see, and awaken to the innate purity of all things.'

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，得清淨力、清淨無畏、清淨佛法。
translation: When this bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains in this way, he attains the power of purity, fearlessness, and purity of the Buddha-dharma.
"Furthermore, good present!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如是學時，於諸有情心行差別皆能通達至極彼岸，方便善巧令諸有情知一切法本性清淨，證得畢竟清涼涅槃。
translation: If bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and students thus train, they'll be able to penetrate all the differences in the minds and actions of sentient beings to the ultimate other shore, skillfully and conveniently cause sentient beings to know the innate purity of all things, and realize ultimate, cool nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 大般若波羅蜜多經卷第五百五十二
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, Vol. 552
